title: Matplotlib backend option for Visualizations
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

It is a normal use case to install ludwig in a remote server and connect via ssh to run experiments, and since data is stored in remote machine user wants to run visualizations via: 

```ludwig visualize```

**Describe the use case**

Create an Compute Engine instance in GCP (Virtual Machine) using Debian 9

```Linux ludwig-vm 4.9.0-9-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.9.168-1+deb9u2 (2019-05-13) x86_64 GNU/Linux```

Connect via gcloud ssh to remote GCP instance using -X option to enable X11 and quartz to be able to display Matplotlib graphs in Local client (MacOS, Windows, Linux, etc.).

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Configuration option to configure matplotlib backend to be able to use Matplotlib over SSH session.
```
ludwig visualize --visualization learning_curves --backend Agg --training_statistics /usr/local/src/ludwig/experiment_run_0/training_statistics.json
```

This will pass a backend parameter which configures the backend in: 
```ludwig/utils/visualization_utils.py```

```
if platform == "darwin":  # OS X
    mpl.use('TkAgg')
```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Build ludwig and configure backend manually

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
